column3:
Haven't tested but from my understanding this would no longer redirect legacy bitcoin: URIs with a testnet address to a testnet instance.

A better solution would be to skip these heuristics entirely if the address is empty.

Thanks @laanwj, check out the latest (4210835) which checks for empty string specifically, prior to parsing the address.  Tested with:

$ ./bitcoin-qt 'bitcoin:?r=http://www.example.com/'
.. fixed the original problem - this launches mainnet.

$ ./bitcoin-qt bitcoin:mngeNQbTKnmaMbx8EXCYdwUbnt9JJD52cC
.. launches testnet

$ ./bitcoin-qt 'bitcoin:1NXXeQRyMFFFRfyUix2o7mk1vhvk2Nxp78'
.. sanit

Automatic sanity-testing: FAILED MERGE, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4411_bffc63073a7b74b4672dddb145cc5956ad0079fa/ for test log.

This pull does not merge cleanly onto current master
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.lo
Now you're forcing the network always to main, even if someone specifies -testnet :)\nPlease keep this line inside the if().\n
In my tests, -testnet still worked as expected, but I updated it as you say.\n
